text:
hi everybody this is mr. Duncan in
England how are you today are you okay I

hope so are you happy I hope so here I
am in my back garden on june the 19th 2012

it's just gone eleven o'clock in the
morning just another hour to go before

lunch hmm one of my favourite times of
the day it summer is here in the UK

which is good news for some people and
bad news for others including me because

today I'm suffering from hay fever my
nose is sore my eyes are red and itchy

and my throat is very sore and i keep
sneezing all the time so I've got my my

little handkerchief here to keep my nose
nice and dry is it I have been receiving

some questions over the last few weeks
and I thought today would be a good

opportunity to answer some of those
questions I've got about nine questions

here to answer dirt over will I get
through this without sneezing I don't

know okay let's have a question one
question what now you are making the

word stop will there be any more full
length lessons from you that is a very

good question the answer is yes I will
be making more full length lessons in

fact right now I'm making lesson number
74 wow all away to 74 incredible and I

hope you are enjoying the word stop I'm
going to be making a few more of those

over the next couple of weeks
and i will be posting the new one each

week so in a few days time they will
start being put on on a weekly basis so

one new word stop every week and of
course lots lots and lots more new

full-length English lessons as well
where have it so exciting you next

question let's have a look will there be
any more ask mr. Duncan episodes and as

a good question the answer to that is
yes I will be making another ask mr.

Duncan very soon I know it's been a long
time since I've done it but I'm hoping

to make another one within the next
couple of weeks I'll keep my fingers

crossed for that one question 3 why do
you always say tatar at the end of your

lessons can you say something else
instead that's a great question at the

end of each lesson of course i always
say tatar for now and that's because

it's a friendly way of saying goodbye so
that's why i do it for a short time I

stopped saying it and I received many
messages from students all around the

world saying mr. Duncan you've stopped
saying tatar for now why can you please

carry on saying it so that's the reason
why i say tatar for now is because if i

stop doing it everybody will complain a
question and before i enjoyed lesson 73

about the olympic games how many people
are involved in making a lesson like

that that's a nice question well as you
know i make a most of my lessons on my

own including my Olympic lesser which
was less than 73 I made it all by myself

with a little bit of help from mr. Steve
of course so to answer your question

most of my videos are made entirely by
me

he questioned five earlier this year you
were in Turkey will you be visiting

another country whoo I like that
question the answer to that is yes I

would like to visit many more countries
of course traveling around the world

takes up a lot of time so if I'm doing
that it means I can't make any new

lessons but I would love to visit
another country very soon maybe

somewhere in Asia maybe somewhere in
South America maybe somewhere in Europe

who knows if you would like me to visit
you all your school why don't you drop

me a line and say hey mr. Duncan I'm a
headmaster of a school and I would like

you to come and visit please come and
visit my school I will think about it so

go on get writing now question 6 why
don't you ever reply to my message I get

that one a lot many many times in fact
the reason why I don't reply to all of

the messages is because I get so many
but I do promise and I can promise right

now that i read all of the messages that
i receive it's just the fact that i

can't reply to them all so if i haven't
replied to you I'm very sorry but I can

promise that i have read it okay okay
okay hmm question 7 do you have a

facebook page yes I do I have a Facebook
page I have around 4,000 friends now

following me on Facebook my facebook
address is mr. Duncan dot uk' in big

capital letters please mr. Duncan dot u
K is my facebook page

whoo so I look forward to seeing you
there soon question 8 can I learn

English alone well I suppose you can yes
the answer to that question is yes if

you are willing to put the work in and
you have enough motivation you can do

anything by yourself and finally
question 9 why do you teach English in

English well that's a good question I
suppose many people ask me this

including people who speak English is
their first language and sometimes they

ask me in a very rude way they say mr.
Duncan you're stupid you teach English in

English why do you do that you you
stupid man well let me explain let me

use a little bit of logic first of all i
speak english and i was able to learn

English without knowing any other
language whatsoever so when I was a

little mr. Duncan I couldn't speak any
language whatsoever so I was able to

learn English without having any
language so if I can do that then I'm

sure somebody who already has a language
to refer to can learn English very

easily so that's the reason why I hope
that explains the question and the

answer ok are we happy with that so
please no more abusive messages cuz cuz

sometimes I trial sad not really ok
that's it I will go back into the house

because I'm about to start sneezing
again and I've just dropped my

handkerchief on the floor as well so
before I start sneezing my head off I

will let you go thank you very much for
watching this and putting it with my my

illness today I'm not really sick it's
sickness it's actually an allergy so

when the pollen is in the air my nose
and my eyes and my throat becomes very

sensitive and I get this every single
summer what a poor man I am I will go

now this is mr. Duncan in his garden
saying thank you for watching me

teaching you and I will see you all
again very soon hopefully feeling a

little better yes I'm going to say ta ta
for now
